breakfast.name: Thai-inspired Oatmeal with Mango and Almonds
breakfast.preparation: Combine oats, almond milk, ginger, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until desired consistency is reached. Top with diced mango, almonds, and chia seeds.
breakfast.nutritionalBenefits: Provides fiber, protein, healthy fats, and vitamins. Mango is a good source of Vitamin C.
breakfast.healthNotes: Oatmeal is a good source of soluble fiber, which can help lower cholesterol. Ginger and cinnamon have anti-inflammatory properties.

lunch.name: Chicken Larb Salad (Thai Ground Chicken Salad)
lunch.preparation: Cook the ground chicken until browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat. In a bowl, combine fish sauce, lime juice, rice vinegar, chili flakes, cilantro, mint, red onion, and green onion. Add the cooked chicken and cooked brown rice to the dressing and mix well. Serve in lettuce cups.
lunch.nutritionalBenefits: High in protein, low in carbohydrates, and rich in herbs and spices. Provides essential amino acids and antioxidants.
lunch.healthNotes: Use low-sodium fish sauce and adjust chili flakes according to your tolerance for spice. This is a lean protein source that aids weight loss efforts.

dinner.name: Thai Green Curry with Tofu and Vegetables
ingredients: 4 oz firm tofu, pressed and cubed
dinner.preparation: Heat coconut oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Add tofu and cook until golden brown. Add broccoli, bell peppers, snap peas, and bamboo shoots and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes. Add green curry paste and coconut milk, bring to a simmer. Stir in fish sauce and lime juice. Simmer for 5 minutes, or until vegetables are tender-crisp. Stir in Thai basil. Serve over cooked quinoa.
dinner.nutritionalBenefits: Provides protein from tofu, fiber from vegetables, and healthy fats from coconut milk. Green curry paste provides a variety of beneficial spices.
dinner.healthNotes: Use low-sodium green curry paste and fish sauce to manage blood pressure. Increase vegetable serving to increase fiber intake.

snacks.name: Edamame
snacks.preparation: Steam edamame pods for 5-7 minutes, or until tender. Sprinkle with sea salt.
snacks.nutritionalBenefits: Provides protein, fiber, and essential nutrients. A good source of plant-based protein.
snacks.healthNotes: Edamame is a low-sodium and healthy snack option.

nutritionalFocus.reason: Helps regulate blood pressure by balancing the effects of sodium.
Promotes satiety, aids digestion, and can help regulate blood sugar levels. Also important for heart health.
Supports muscle mass, boosts metabolism, and helps you feel full and satisfied. Crucial for weight loss.

avoidList.reason: Can increase blood pressure and lead to fluid retention. Avoid processed foods, fast food, and excessive salt intake.

weeklyHabitTips: Monitor your blood pressure regularly and keep a record for your doctor.
Engage in at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise most days of the week.
Practice mindful eating by paying attention to your hunger and fullness cues.
